In India, we don't say 'Excuse me'. We just gently push the person and say 'Thoda side please'.

Why do Indian moms ask 'Kya khaya?' (What did you eat?) every time you call? It's their way of checking if you are still alive.

Indian 'Work From Home' is 10% working and 90% shouting 'Mummy, cooker ki city baj gayi band kar do!' (Mom, turn off the cooker!).
The level of negotiation skills required to buy clothes in Sarojini Nagar should be taught in MBA schools.
At a buffet, Indians don't eat according to appetite. They eat according to the price of the ticket. 'I paid 800, I will eat 800 worth.'
My dad treats the car AC like it consumes rocket fuel. He turns it off at every red light.
The scariest thing to hear in a movie theater: A baby crying. The second scariest: Someone explaining the plot loudly to their grandmother.

Indian street dogs are smarter than traffic police. They know exactly when the signal will turn green.
Why do we say 'Light aa gayi' (Light has come) when power returns? Because for those 10 minutes of darkness, we returned to the Stone Age.

My cousin is an 'Influencer'. Her influence is limited to making me take 500 photos of her until she likes one.

The joy of finding a 100 rupee note in an old pair of jeans is greater than getting a salary hike.
Indian relatives will ask 'Beta, what is your package?' but will never ask 'Beta, are you happy?'
I tried to make Roti. It looked like a map of Australia. My mom said, 'At least you are global.'

The 'General Compartment' of a train smells of 50 different types of pickles and shared humanity.
I told my dad I want to be a writer. He said, 'Write the grocery list first, then we will see.'
Indian Winters: When you wear a Monkey Cap and look like a burglar inside your own house.
The most aggressive people on earth are not wrestlers. They are people trying to board a Virar Fast Local train.
My mom's logic: If I don't pick up the phone in 3 rings, I have definitely been kidnapped.
Why did the Indian guy put his phone in the fridge? Because he wanted to have cool conversations.
The real test of friendship is not lending money. It is sharing your Hotspot data when the daily limit is reached.

My neighbors have a new dog. It barks in a rhythm. I think it is trying to communicate in Morse code.
Indian weddings have a 'Reception'. It is basically a line where you stand for 45 minutes to hand over an envelope and smile for 2 seconds.
The 'Middle Class' dream: To have a house big enough that the kitchen smells don't reach the bedroom.

The most dangerous job interview question: 'Tell me about yourself.' *Brain freezes*. *Forgets name*. *Says 'I like cricket'.*

Why do we keep the plastic cover on the new car seats? To keep the resale value high for the next 10 years.

I went to a 'Stand-up Comedy' show. The comedian roasted the front row so bad, I sat in the last row behind a pillar.
Indian roads are 50% tarmac, 50% potholes, and 100% adventure.
Why is it called 'Fast Food'? In India, it takes 20 minutes to make, and you eat it standing on the road.
My grandmother thinks my ripped jeans are a result of a bicycle accident.

Why do we tap the remote when it stops working? We are giving it CPR.

My dad wears a dhoti at home. It is the ultimate ventilation system.

Indian weddings are incomplete without that one drunk uncle dancing with a glass on his head.
Why did the Sharmaji ka beta become a doctor? Because 'YouTuber' was not an option in the family WhatsApp group.
The 'No Smoking' ads before movies in India are scarier than the actual horror movie.

My laptop fan sounds like a helicopter taking off. I think it wants to fly to the US.

Why do we have 'Guest Slippers'? Who are these guests who don't have their own shoes?
I tried to explain 'NFTs' to my dad. He said, 'So you bought a photo of a monkey for 1 Lakh? Get out.'

The 'S' in Indian Education stands for 'Stress'.

In India, we don't play 'Antakshari' for fun. We play to judge people who sing 'Mai' songs when the letter is 'M'.
My gym trainer told me to do 'Deadlifts'. I told him I already carry the burden of my parents' expectations.
Delhi Winter: People wearing 3 jackets, gloves, and a muffler. Mumbai Winter: People turn off the fan for 10 minutes.
The most intense staredown in history happens when two people spot the same empty seat on the Metro.
I told my grandmother I have a headache. She applied 'Zandu Balm' so close to my eyes that now I have a headache AND I am blind.
Indian 'Jugaad': Fixing a broken eyeglass frame with white tape and pretending it is a new fashion trend.
The 'Intermission' in an Indian movie is not for the bathroom. It is to discuss 'Who is the killer?' with your friend.
My friend is a 'Food Blogger'. He spends 15 minutes setting the angle. By the time we eat, the food is colder than his ex's heart.
Why do we lick the yogurt lid? Because we paid for the whole cup, including the part stuck to the foil.
The 'Shaktimaan' spin was the first dance move every Indian 90s kid learned.
I asked the auto driver 'Kitna loge?' (How much?). He looked at my clothes, my watch, and my shoes, then quoted the GDP of a small country.
Indian superstitions: If a black cat crosses your path, it means the animal is going somewhere. But we stop the car and pray.
The 'Free WiFi' at railway stations works great, if you want to download a file in the year 2050.
My dad thinks putting the phone in a bowl of rice fixes water damage. He treats electronics like Biryani ingredients.
The most dangerous phrase used by a Barber: 'Bas thoda sa adjust kar raha hoon' (Just adjusting a little). You are about to go bald.
I went to a South Indian wedding. I finished breakfast at 7 AM. By 8 AM, they were serving lunch. It was a marathon of eating.
Why do we keep 'Carry Bags' inside a bigger 'Carry Bag'? It is the Inception of plastics.
The 'Society Watchman' whistles at night not to scare thieves, but to let us know he is awake and bored.
I tried to explain 'Space X' to my uncle. He asked 'Is it better than Alto?'
Indian 'Pani Puri' vendors have the cleanest hands in the world. They dip them in 'Tamarind Water' 500 times a day. It is sanitizer.
The 'School Project' was never done by the student. It was a competition between the fathers of the class.
Why do we look at the gas cylinder regulator before leaving the house? To make sure it hasn't secretly turned itself on.
My mom's favorite yoga pose is 'Shavasana' (Corpse Pose). She does it every afternoon from 2 PM to 4 PM.
The 'Tatkal Ticket' booking experience: 9:59 AM - Logged in. 10:00 AM - Loading. 10:01 AM - Seats Full. 10:02 AM - Crying.
I saw a sign 'Work in Progress'. In India, that means 'Come back in 3 years'.
The 'Toothpick' at restaurants is used less for teeth and more for playing with while waiting for the bill.
Indian Moms can make a full dinner out of leftovers. She calls it 'Mix Veg'. We call it 'Fridge Cleaning'.
The 'Online Class' mute button is the only reason I still have a job.
Why do we say 'God Promise'? Because a regular promise has no market value in India.
The 'Petrol Pump' attendant asks 'Zero check kiya?' (Did you check zero?). It is the most important trust exercise in the country.
I bought a kindle. My dad asked 'Can we put a newspaper cover on it?' Old habits die hard.
The 'Street Dog' chasing you is scary. But the 'Street Dog' ignoring you hurts your ego.
Indian politicians and Indian roads have one thing in common: They both promise a smooth ride but deliver potholes.
My friend ordered 'Sushi'. He ate it with his hands and asked for 'Green Chutney'. The waiter fainted.
The 'Morning Walk' group of uncles discusses everything from World Politics to whose daughter-in-law wakes up late.
Why do we slap the TV remote? We believe in 'Violence against Electronics'.
The 'Geometry Box' compass was used for geometry 1% of the time and for carving names on the bench 99% of the time.
I went to a 'Hair Salon'. The guy washed my hair, massaged my head, cracked my neck, and almost realigned my chakras. Best Rs. 100 spent.
The 'Mosquito Bat' is the national sport of India in the evenings. The 'Zap' sound is satisfying.
Indian Guests: 'We are leaving.' *Stands up*. *Talks for 20 mins*. *Moves to door*. *Talks for 10 mins*. *Gate*. *Talks*. Finally leaves.
I tried to use 'Siri' with my Indian accent. She started Googling 'Recipes for Butter Chicken'. I was asking for the weather.
The 'Luggage Chain' on trains: We chain our bags to the seat like we are transporting gold bars, even if the bag only has dirty clothes.
Why do we have a 'Showcase' in the living room full of dolls and cups that we are forbidden to touch?
The 'Bus Conductor' has the best balance. He can walk through a moving bus without holding anything while counting cash.
My mom thinks 'Pizza' causes cold, cough, fever, and low marks. It is a biological weapon.
The 'Cricket Ball' falling in the neighbor's house is a diplomatic crisis. You need a negotiator to get it back.
I told my boss 'I am burnout'. He said 'Take a break, work on the PPT from home'.
The 'Vegetable Peeler' disappears exactly when you need to peel potatoes. It goes to Narnia.
Indian dads keep the phone ringtone on 'Maximum Volume'. When it rings, birds fly away in fear.
Why do we say 'Do one thing' (Ek kaam kar) when we are about to give a list of 5 things to do?
The 'Samosa' is triangular so that it fits perfectly in the corner of your mouth while you drive.
My friend's 'Ring Ceremony' had more photographers than guests. I felt like I was at a press conference.
The 'Ceiling Fan' at speed 5 sounds like a helicopter landing. We sleep peacefully through it.
I asked a stranger for a charger. He gave me his power bank. I think we are married now.
The 'Expiry Date' on pickle jars is a myth. Pickle lasts forever. It outlives civilizations.
Why do we stand up as soon as the flight lands? Do we want to help the pilot park the plane?
The 'News Anchor' screams so loud, I lower the volume to check if he is actually fighting with someone in my living room.
I tried to explain 'Minimalism' to my mom. She said 'Okay, let's start by throwing away your video games'. Backfired.
The 'Auto-Rickshaw' meter is the only machine in the world that runs faster than time itself.
Indian 'Traffic Jams' are great for productivity. I finished a podcast, wrote a book, and aged 5 years at Silk Board junction.
Why do we say 'Last price' while bargaining? We both know there are at least 3 more 'Last prices' to go.
The 'Newspaper' in the morning is not for reading. It is for checking which local shop has a sale.
My dad wears sunglasses indoors. He says 'It is style'. Mom says 'He forgot where he kept his regular glasses'.
The 'Water Filter' (RO) makes a weird noise at 3 AM. It sounds like it is purifying the souls of the house.
I went to a 'Destination Wedding'. The destination was just 50km away, but the traffic made it feel like another continent.
The 'Mobile Screen Guard' is cracked, but we don't change it. We scroll around the cracks. Adaptation.
Why do we have 'Guest Soap'? It is a tiny, fancy soap that smells like lavender and dissolves if you look at it.
The 'Tiffin Box' exchange in school was the first 'Barter System' we learned. 'I give you Aloo Bhindi, you give me Pasta'.
My mom's 'Tupperware' has a higher security clearance than nuclear codes. If I lose a lid, I have to leave the country.
The 'Blanket' in Indian AC trains is made of a material that keeps you cold in winter and hot in summer. It defies science.
I asked my friend 'Where are you?'. He sent a photo of a tree. Thanks, that really narrows it down.
The 'Temple Queue': We push and shove to get God's blessing. It's ironic.
Why do we use 'Old Toothbrushes' to clean combs and jewelry? They get a second life as cleaning tools.
The 'Elevator Mirror' is the most popular selfie spot. If you didn't take a photo, did you even go to work?
My dad explains directions using hands. 'Go straight (hand chop), take left (hand swerve), then huge building (hand circle)'.
The 'Courier Guy' calls you when he is outside your door. 'Sir, bell baja raha hoon' (Sir, I am ringing the bell).
I bought a 'Gym Ball'. I sit on it and eat chips. It counts as 'Active Sitting'.
The 'Office Laptop' takes 15 minutes to start. That is my meditation time.
Why do we ask 'Can I ask a doubt?' in class? You just asked one.
The 'Restaurant Bill' arrives. The group goes silent. Everyone pretends to check their phone calculators.
My mom's 'Saree Pleats' are mathematically perfect. She could teach geometry.
The 'Power Bank' is the modern life support system. If it dies, we die.
I told the tailor 'Make it tight'. He made it so tight I can't breathe. He said 'It is fashion'.
The 'Diwali Bonus' is a myth. We get a box of 'Soan Papdi' that has been circulating since 2010.
Why do we keep the 'User Manual'? We never read it. We just press all buttons until it works.
The 'Parking Guy' directs you: 'Aaja, aaja, aaja' (Come, come, come). *Bang*. 'Bas, bas' (Stop).
I tried to explain 'Gluten Free' to my maid. She brought me 'Roti' with extra butter. She thinks Gluten is a lack of butter.
The 'Balcony' is not for fresh air. It is for drying clothes and staring at neighbors.
My dad's wallet is 5 inches thick. It has receipts from 1985. 'You never know when you need proof of purchase for a toaster bought in 1990'.
The 'Coconut Water' guy cuts the coconut with a machete like a ninja. One wrong move and I lose an ear.
Why do we say 'Nice Name' when we meet someone? We don't care about the name. We just need filler words.
The 'WhatsApp Group' admin feels like the CEO of a Fortune 500 company. 'I will remove you' is their ultimate threat.
I went to a 'Silent Disco'. It was just a bunch of Indians dancing off-beat to different songs. Chaos in silence.
The 'Toll Booth' line is where you learn which lane moves the slowest. It is always the one you are in.
My mom checks the 'MRP' before checking the ingredients. 'It is expensive, so it must be healthy'.
The 'Street Light' outside my house flickers. It adds a horror movie vibe to my evening walk.
Why do we cover the car with a 'Car Cover' every night? To protect it from the moon? It takes 15 minutes to take off.
The most dangerous negotiation in the world is not by the FBI. It is by the Bride's sisters during the 'Juta Churai' (Shoe Stealing) ceremony.
Indian Office AC Wars: Half the office is sweating in the Sahara, the other half is freezing in Antarctica. The remote is the weapon of power.
I told my P.T. Teacher I have a stomach ache. He said 'Run 2 rounds, gas will pass'. Medical science is shaking.
The 'Guest Towel' is so soft and clean. I am scared to use it. I just wipe my hands on my pants and come out.
My mom's purse is a black hole. It contains keys, tissues, safety pins, almonds, and receipts from 2003. But she can never find her phone.
Why do Indian uncles chew paan and talk? It sounds like they are speaking in a secret underwater language.
The 'Trial Ball' in Gully Cricket is the only second chance you get in life. If you get out, it doesn't count. If you hit a six, it counts.
I bought a 'White Shirt'. My mom washed it with a red sock. Now I have a 'Pink Shirt'. She calls it 'Tie-Dye'.
The 'Bus Seat' reservation system: Putting a handkerchief through the window. It is legally binding.
My dad types on WhatsApp with one finger, staring at the screen like he is defusing a bomb.
The 'Street Food' plate is usually a piece of newspaper. You get news and chutney in one bite.
Why do we say 'Cut the call' instead of 'Hang up'? Because in the landline days, we literally cut the connection.
The 'Maid' (Bai) is the actual owner of the house. If she decides to take leave, the economy of the household collapses.
I went to a 'Fancy Hair Salon'. They charged Rs. 500 for a 'Stylist Cut'. I looked in the mirror and I still looked like a potato.
Indian 'Horror Stories' start with: 'My friend's cousin's neighbor went to a graveyard at night...'
The 'Mosquito Coil' holder is always lost. We balance the coil on a random bottle cap or a coin.
My mom's 'Tupperware' lid is missing. The house is under investigation. Interpol has been notified.
The 'Local Train' handles have germs from 1985. We hold them anyway because falling is worse than bacteria.
Why do we ask 'Aur sunao?' (Tell me more) on the phone? We have nothing to say, but we don't want to cut the call.
The 'Groom' arriving on a horse looks royal until the horse decides to stop for a snack in the middle of the procession.
I tried to make 'Chai' for my dad. He took one sip and asked 'Is this hot water with color?'
The 'Wedding Reception' stage is so bright with lights that the couple gets a tan by the end of the night.
Indian 'Road Humps' are unpainted. You hit them at 60kmph and your soul leaves your body for a second.
My friend said 'I am busy'. I checked his Steam profile. He has been playing 'Counter-Strike' for 6 hours.
The 'Tailor' always writes the measurements in a notebook that looks like it survived a war. And he still loses it.
Why do we put 'Cover' on the washing machine? Is it going to catch a cold?
The 'Bank Lunch Time' is a myth. It is a continuous loop. You enter at 11, it's lunch. You enter at 2, it's tea break.
I asked my mom for 'Space'. She said 'Clean your room, you will find lots of space'.
The 'Movie Ticket' price is Rs. 300. The 'Popcorn' price is Rs. 400. The 'Water Bottle' is Rs. 100. I should have just bought the cinema hall.
Indian 'Traffic' is the best place to observe human behavior. You see anger, acceptance, and people eating breakfast in cars.
My dad's 'Sneezing' style is not a reflex. It is an announcement. 'AAAA-CHOOO!' followed by a shiver.
The 'Cable Management' behind the TV is a bird's nest of wires. If you pull one, the lights in the neighbor's house might go off.
Why do we say 'Nice to meet you' to relatives we hate? It is called 'Sanskaar' (Culture).
The 'Coconut Oil' freezes in winter. You have to melt the bottle in hot water like you are conducting a science experiment.
I tried to follow a 'Youtube Recipe'. The chef said 'Add a pinch of salt'. I added a pinch. It tasted like paper.
The 'School Uniform' white shirt was white only on Monday morning. By Monday afternoon, it was ink-blue and dirt-brown.
Why do we look at the 'MRP' and then ask 'Discount hai kya?' (Is there a discount?). It is our birthright.
The 'Lift' fan is always broken. You suffocate for 30 seconds while staring awkwardly at a stranger.
My mom's 'Goodnight' routine involves checking if the main door is locked 5 times. Even if she just checked it.
The 'Auto Driver' sits at the edge of the seat. If he sits back, the auto will lose balance. Physics.
I bought a 'Bean Bag'. Now I am too lazy to get up from it. I live in the bean bag now.
The 'Relative' who gives you Rs. 500 when leaving is the favorite relative. The one who gives Rs. 100 is judged.
Why do we say 'Just 2 minutes' when we haven't even left the house? We are optimistic about teleportation.
The 'Hostel Mattress' is as thin as a roti. You can feel the bed frame counting your ribs.
I asked the 'Carpenter' to come at 10 AM. He came at 4 PM. He said 'Traffic'. He lives next door.
The 'Water Heater' switch is outside the bathroom. You have to yell 'Geyser band kar do!' (Turn off the geyser) while dripping wet.
Indian 'News Debates' have 10 panels windows. Everyone is shouting. Nobody can hear anything. It is modern art.
My dad wears 'White Shoes' for morning walks. He cleans them daily. They are cleaner than my conscience.
The 'Vegetable Chopping' board is used for everything. Chopping veggies, crushing ginger, and threatening kids.
Why do we put 'Newspaper' on shelves? To protect the wood? Or to read news from 2015 while cleaning?
The 'Metro Announcement': 'Doors will open on the left'. Everyone rushes to the left like the boat is sinking.
I tried to use 'Chopsticks' at an Asian restaurant. I ended up stabbing the sushi. I ate with my hands eventually.
The 'School Bell' ringing 5 minutes early was the greatest joy. It felt like getting out of prison on parole.
My mom thinks 'Headphones' cause ear infections, brain damage, and bad behavior. They are evil devices.
The 'Rickshaw' turns without signaling. The driver uses telepathy. You should have known he was turning.
Why do we say 'Adjust maadi' (Please adjust) in a bus seat meant for 2 people where 4 are already sitting?
The 'Online Delivery' box is huge. Inside is a tiny USB drive and 50 meters of bubble wrap.
I told my dad 'I am depressed'. He said 'Wake up at 5 AM, go for a walk, drink cow urine'. Thanks dad.
The 'Ceiling' in old houses has hooks for swings. Now we just use them to hang dried flowers.
Indian 'Soap Operas' zoom in on the face 5 times with 'Dhum Tana Nana' music. It takes 2 minutes to show one reaction.
My friend 'Treats' us only when he fails. When he passes, he disappears.
The 'Wedding Buffet' plate arrangement: Rice at the bottom, Curry on top, Roti on side, Sweet on top of curry. Chaos.
Why do we say 'Backside' of the building? Is there a 'Frontside'? Just say 'Back'.
The 'Car Horn' is used to say Hello, Move, Stop, Hurry Up, and Angry insults. It is a versatile instrument.
I bought 'Organic Vegetables'. They look like regular vegetables but cost 3 times more and rot in 1 day.
The 'Government Office' file moves slower than a glacier. You need to reincarnate to see it finished.
My mom's 'Slipper' has GPS tracking. No matter where I run, it finds me.
The 'Tea Stall' glass is small, but the 'Cutting Chai' hits harder than Red Bull.
I asked the 'Plumber' to fix the leak. He put M-Seal on it. It looks like chewing gum, but it holds the ocean back.
The 'Exam Paper' had questions I had never seen. I wrote answers the teacher had never seen. We are even.
Why do we keep the 'Plastic Wrap' on the remote? To keep it new? It feels like touching a raincoat.
The 'Local Bus' stops in the middle of the road. You have to jump out while it is still moving. It is an action movie.
My dad reads the 'Obituary' column first. He checks if anyone he knows has 'departed'. It is his morning social media.
The 'Gym Trainer' counts '1, 2, 3...'. Then he talks to a girl. Then he continues '4, 5...'. I held the weight for 5 minutes.
I told my mom 'I am full'. She put one more Roti on my plate. 'This is for your long life'. Emotional blackmail.
The 'Electrician' strips the wire with his teeth. He is immune to shock. He is Electro.
Why do we say 'Loose Motion'? Is there a 'Tight Motion'? It sounds like a mechanical failure.
The 'College Canteen' Samosa has more potato than the entire state of Punjab. The outer crust is just a formality.
My friend has a 'DSLR'. He takes photos of flowers, dogs, and trash cans. He calls it 'Art'.
The 'Rain' in India stops, but the 'Traffic' due to rain lasts for 3 days. The roads have memory.
I asked for 'Mineral Water'. The waiter brought a bottle with a broken seal. I looked at him. He looked at me. We both knew.
The 'Office Chair' squeaks. Every time I move, it sounds like I am farting. I sit statue-still now.
My mom's 'Spice Box' (Masala Dabba) has 7 compartments. It is the chemistry set of the kitchen.
The 'TTE' on the train looks at your ticket, looks at your face, looks at the ticket again. He suspects you are an imposter.
Why do we say 'Heavy Rain'? How much does it weigh? Just say 'It is pouring'.
The 'Laptop Charger' cable is always too short. I have to sit on the floor near the socket like a punished child.
I went to a 'Buffet'. I ate so much I couldn't walk. I took an auto for 500 meters. Profit loss statement: Negative.
The 'Watchman' salutes you only during Diwali. The rest of the year, he ignores your existence.
My dad's 'Phone Gallery' is full of 'Good Morning' roses and blurry photos of documents.
The 'Street Vendor' wraps the food in a paper that has your exam results on it. Life comes full circle.
I tried to 'Bargain' in a mall. I asked 'Discount?'. The cashier pointed to the sign 'Fixed Price'. I felt shame.
The 'Ceiling Fan' wobbles at high speed. It looks like it is going to detach and decapitate us. We sleep under it anyway.
Why do we say 'Passing the time'? Time is passing anyway. You are just existing.
The 'Mosquito' buzzes in your ear. You slap yourself. The mosquito flies away laughing.
My mom thinks 'Pizza' is just 'Roti with Sabzi on top'. She is technically not wrong.
The 'Cricket Match' is on. The streets are empty. It is a self-imposed curfew.
I bought 'Sunglasses'. I look like a blind man. My friend looks like Tom Cruise. Life is unfair.
The 'Office Meeting' could have been an email. We sat for 2 hours discussing 'Synergy'.
My dad checks the 'Car Tyres' by kicking them. 'Haan, hawa hai' (Yes, there is air). Accurate measurement.
The 'Train Toilet' door is so heavy you need bodybuilding training to open it.
Finding an 'Elaichi' (Cardamom) in your Biryani is the biggest trust betrayal in human history.
No party in India is complete until a drunk uncle gets on the floor and does the 'Naagin Dance'.
My dad's advice for every illness: 'Drink hot water'. Fever? Hot water. Fracture? Hot water. Bankruptcy? Hot water.
The 'Notice Period' in an Indian company is 3 months. It is longer than some celebrity marriages.
I went to a 'Saree Sale'. It was a contact sport. I saw an aunty tackle a security guard for a Kanjeevaram.
The 'OTP' never arrives when you are in a hurry. It arrives 20 minutes later when you are already asleep.
Why do we say 'Out of Station'? Are we trains? Just say 'Out of Town'.
My mom recycles 'Gift Envelopes'. I received an envelope on my birthday that had 'Best Wishes, Rakesh' crossed out and 'Happy Birthday' written on it.
The 'Project Manager' asks 'When can you deliver?'. I say 'Friday'. He hears 'Monday'. We compromise on 'Yesterday'.
Indian 'Traffic Police' don't wear body cams. They have 'Challan Books' that appear out of thin air.
I tried to explain 'Depression' to my dad. He said 'Stop waking up at 12 PM, depression will go away'.
The 'Hostel Warden' is stricter than a prison guard. 'Lights off at 10 PM'. But we are engineers, our day starts at 10 PM.
Why do we have 'Cans of Paint' from 2005 stored in the balcony? Are we planning to repaint a single square inch of the wall?
The 'Mobile Data' ends. The speed drops to 2G. Loading Google takes 4 business days.
My friend returned from the USA after 6 months. He now has an accent. He calls 'Tomato' as 'Toe-may-toe'. We slapped him back to factory settings.
The 'Vegetable Vendor' sprinkles water on the veggies to keep them fresh. By the evening, he is selling 50% vegetable, 50% water.
I ordered 'Hakka Noodles'. It was just Maggi with capsicum. I felt cheated but I ate it.
The 'Family Doctor' knows your entire history. 'You had a cold in 1998, remember?'. No doc, I was 2 years old.
Why do we keep the 'Sticker' on the new cap? To show it is authentic? It looks like you forgot to remove the price tag.
The 'Wedding Invitation' card is so thick and heavy, you could use it as a weapon for self-defense.
My dad watches news debates at full volume. 'The nation wants to know!'. Dad, the neighbors want to sleep.
The 'Pani Puri' guy asks 'Teekha ya Meetha?' (Spicy or Sweet?). If you say 'Meetha', society judges you.
I told my boss 'I have a doctor's appointment'. He asked 'Is it serious?'. I said 'Yes, I am sick of this job'.
The 'Indian Toilet' vs 'Western Toilet' debate in households is more heated than politics.
Why do we say 'Brother' to strangers? 'Auto Brother', 'Shopkeeper Brother'. We are a nation of siblings.
The 'Electricity Bill' comes. My dad turns off the lights, the fan, the fridge, and tells us to stop breathing to save energy.
I went to a 'Club'. The DJ played 'Punjabi Music'. Then 'EDM'. Then 'Bollywood'. It was a musical khichdi.
The 'Gym' subscription is for 1 year. I went for 3 days. Cost per visit: Rs. 5000.
My mom puts 'Newspaper' in the shelves. She changes it every Diwali. I read news from last year while cleaning.
The 'Bus Driver' brakes suddenly. The standing passengers fly to the front. 'Ticket ticket!'. No, we are flying.
I asked for 'Wi-Fi Password'. The waiter said '12345678'. I asked 'Is it safe?'. He said 'Sir, nobody hacks the Dosa corner'.
The 'Indian Flag' on Independence Day is everywhere. On the car, on the bike, on the shirt. On August 16th, it is nowhere.
My dad thinks 'Video Games' break the TV. 'The pixels will burn!'. Dad, it is an LED TV.
The 'Street Dog' barks at the car tyres. He hates MRF ZLX for some reason.
I tried to make 'Round Roti'. It turned into a triangle. I told my mom it is a 'Paratha'. Adaptation.
The 'Government Hospital' queue. You age 10 years while waiting for a slip.
Why do we say 'Good name?' (Shubh Naam). Is there a 'Bad name'?
The 'Auto' rear view mirror is turned inwards so the driver can look at himself. He doesn't care about traffic behind him.
My mom's 'Sewing Kit' is in a 'Danish Cookies' tin. I open it expecting cookies, I find needles. Disappointment.
The 'Online Shopping' return policy. 'Keep the item, we will refund you'. I feel like a thief.
I asked my dad for 'Pocket Money'. He asked for a 'Business Plan'.
The 'School Water Cooler'. The water tasted like steel and friendship.
Why do we say 'Simply' when asked 'What are you doing?'. 'Simply sitting'. It is a state of being.
The 'Barber' asks 'Massage?'. He cracks your neck. You see heaven for a second. 'Rs. 50 sir'.
My friend's 'Ring tone' is a crying baby. Everyone looks around in panic. He just answers 'Hello?'. Psychopath.
The 'Tea' at the railway station is so hot it melts the cup. You have to drink it in 2 seconds before the train starts.
I went to a 'Hill Station'. Everyone was eating Maggi. It is the national food of mountains.
The 'Resort' photos showed a swimming pool. In reality, it was a large bathtub with 10 people in it.
Why do we use 'Horn' at a red light? Do we think the sound waves will turn the light green?
The 'Office Canteen' food. Monday: Dal. Tuesday: Dal. Wednesday: Dal with Tadka. Innovation.
My dad's 'Sneakers' are white New Balance. He is ready to mow a lawn, but we live in an apartment.
The 'Toll Plaza' Fastag line is slower than the Cash line. Technology is amazing.
I told my mom 'I am going vegan'. She said 'Good, Paneer is expensive anyway'.
The 'Society Meeting'. Uncle 1: 'Water issue'. Uncle 2: 'Parking issue'. Uncle 3: 'Who threw garbage from the balcony?'. War ensues.
Why do we say 'Foreign Return'? As if they returned from Mars. 'My cousin is foreign return'.
The 'Luggage Trolley' at the airport. One wheel always spins in the wrong direction. You drift like a rally car.
I tried to use 'Chopsticks'. I flicked a peanut into the next table's soup. I apologized and left.
The 'Dentist' asks questions while his hands are in your mouth. 'So, what do you do?'. 'Aggghhh ghhhuuu'.
My mom's 'Whatsapp Status' is a video of a flower blooming with 'Good Morning' written in glitter font.
The 'Courier' needs an OTP. I give him the OTP. He says 'Wrong OTP'. We stare at each other. It is a standoff.
I bought 'Slim Fit' jeans. I can't bend my knees. I walk like a penguin. Fashion.
The 'Movie' starts. The national anthem plays. We stand up. The guy with the popcorn struggles to balance patriotism and snacks.
Why do we say 'Keep in touch' to school friends? We never keep in touch. We just like their photos once a year.
The 'Power Cut' happens. We check if the neighbors have power. If they do, it is a personal tragedy. If they don't, we relax.
I ordered 'Coffee' at a South Indian wedding. It came in a steel tumbler so hot I burned my fingerprints off.
The 'Hotel Key Card' never works on the first try. You have to swipe it slow, fast, wiggle it. It is a skill.
My dad asks 'Who is this?' to every actor on TV. 'Is he Amitabh's son?'. No dad, that is Tom Cruise.
The 'Rain' starts. The 'Dish TV' signal goes. We stare at the 'No Signal' screen like it is a show.
I asked for 'Directions'. The uncle said 'Go straight, then left, then ask someone else'. He passed the responsibility.
The 'Exam Result' day. Relatives call you who haven't spoken to you in 5 years. 'How much percentage?'.
Why do we have 'Show Towels' in the bathroom that we are not allowed to use?
The 'Auto' doesn't have a meter. The driver calculates the fare based on your face and the position of the moon.
I tried to 'Bake a Cake'. It turned out hard as a brick. We used it as a doorstopper.
The 'Online Meeting'. 'Am I audible?'. 'Yes'. 'Can you see my screen?'. 'Yes'. 'Okay, let's start'. Connection lost.
My mom's 'Alarm' is her voice screaming 'Uth ja!'. It is more effective than any app.
The 'Bus' is full. You stand on one leg. The bus turns. You dance like Michael Jackson to keep balance.
Why do we put 'Lemon and Chili' on new cars? To protect it from accidents? Or to make a salad in an emergency?
The 'Wedding Photographer' blinds you with the flash. You see white spots for the next 3 days.
I asked for 'Extra Ketchup'. The McDonald's guy gave me one packet. I felt rationed.
The 'Train Fan' doesn't rotate. It just vibrates aggressively.
My dad's 'Phone Password' is '1234'. He says 'Who will steal my data?'. Dad, your bank account is on there.
The 'Street Cricket' rule. If the ball goes into the 'Grumpy Uncle's' house, the game is over.
I went to a 'Buffet'. I saw a guy stacking chicken on his plate like a Jenga tower. Respect.
The 'Lift' buttons. We press the button even if it is already lit. We think it makes the lift come faster.
My mom buys 'Vegetables' in bulk. 'It was cheap'. Now we eat Cabbage for 7 days.
The 'Link Aadhaar' message. It pops up everywhere. Bank, Phone, Tinder. 'Link Aadhaar to find a match'.
I asked the 'Waiter' for the WiFi password. He typed it in my phone himself. He didn't trust me with the secret.
The 'Raincoat' smells of old rubber and despair. But it keeps you dry.
My dad checks the 'Lock' on the car door by pulling the handle so hard he almost rips it off.
The 'Exam Invigilator' walks slowly between the desks. He stops near you. Your heart stops. He moves on.
Why do we say 'Time is Money'? But then we spend 2 hours bargaining to save Rs. 50.
The 'Sofa' has plastic covers on the armrests. It sticks to your skin in summer. It is a trap.
I asked for 'Mineral Water'. The bottle cost Rs. 60. I drank it like it was holy water.
The 'Auto Driver' says 'Change nahi hai' (No change). You give him Rs. 10 extra. He wins.
My mom's 'Handbag' is heavy. She carries the weight of the world and a water bottle in it.
The 'Flight' lands. Everyone claps. Why? Did we think we weren't going to make it?
I tried to 'Diet'. I saw a Samosa. The diet ended. It was a short life.
The 'Train' is late by 4 hours. The announcement says 'Inconvenience is regretted'. We are used to it.
My dad wears 'Socks' with sandals. It is the ultimate dad fashion statement.
The 'Vegetable Vendor' gives you free 'Curry Leaves'. It is the loyalty program of the street.
I told my mom I want to start a business. She turned into a Shark Tank judge. 'Where is the revenue? Why is your room dirty? I am out.'
The 'General Bogie' in Indian trains has its own ecosystem. People sleep on the floor, on the luggage rack, and sometimes levitate in the air due to lack of space.
My dad uses his index finger to type on the phone with the force of a hammer. He is not typing, he is punishing the screen.
In India, 'Full Cream Milk' is a luxury. 'Toned Milk' is water with white coloring. 'Double Toned' is just a memory of a cow.
The 'Resort' swimming pool had so much chlorine, I came out bleached white. I looked like Michael Jackson.
Why do Indian shops put 'Fixed Price' signs? To test our willpower. We still ask 'Bhaiya, kuch kam karo' (Brother, lower it a bit).
The 'Office Laptop' battery lasts 15 minutes. It is a desktop with a mood swing.
I asked the 'Auto Driver' to go by the meter. He laughed so hard he choked on his chai.
The 'Street Light' turns on at 6 PM and turns off at 6:05 PM. It is on a strict diet of electricity.
My mom's 'Good Morning' messages have escalated. Now they include 4K videos of waterfalls with flute music.
The 'Wedding Gift' envelope is empty. I forgot to put money in it. I am now a fugitive.
Why do we say 'Timepass' when eating peanuts? Because shelling them takes longer than eating them.
The 'Rickshaw' has a sound system better than a nightclub. Bass boosted 'Kumar Sanu' songs at 9 AM.
I tried to 'Google' my symptoms. It said I have 3 hours to live. It was just gas.
The 'School Assembly' prayer was the only time we closed our eyes, not to pray, but to sleep while standing.
Indian 'Traffic' is a mix of cars, bikes, cows, dogs, and pedestrians playing Frogger.
My dad's 'Sneezing' wakes up the neighbors. They think a bomb went off.
The 'Power Bank' cable is tangled. It looks like a snake knot. I spent 20 minutes untying it.
I went to a 'Buffet'. I ate 10 plates. The manager offered me money to leave.
The 'Vegetable Vendor' gives you 'Free Chili' like it is gold bullion. 'Take it, enjoy'.
Why do we say 'Backside' of the shop? Is the shop a person?
The 'Online Class' video freezes. The teacher's face is stuck in a funny expression. We take screenshots.
My mom thinks 'Video Games' are the reason for Global Warming. 'You play too much, the earth is heating up'.
The 'Bus Conductor' has a whistle. He blows it for everything. Stop, Go, Move, Breathe.
I asked for 'Extra Cheese' on my Pizza. They put one shred of cheese. I felt insulted.
The 'Mosquito' bites you on the knuckle. It is the most painful place. Calculated attack.
Why do we put 'Newspaper' on the shelves? To read old news while searching for the turmeric powder?
The 'Raincoat' makes you sweat more than the rain wets you. It is a sauna suit.
My dad checks the 'Lock' on the door 3 times. 'Click, Click, Click'. Security check complete.
The 'Exam Paper' was in Greek. I wrote in Latin. We communicated in ancient tongues.
I told my mom 'I am full'. She said 'Eat one more for my sake'. Emotional blackmail at the dining table.
The 'Electrician' fixes the fan with a piece of cardboard. 'It will work for 10 years'. Engineering.
Why do we say 'Loose Motion'? Is there a 'Tight Motion'? It sounds mechanical.
The 'College Canteen' Samosa is 90% potato, 10% hope.
My friend has a 'DSLR'. He takes photos of dustbins. 'It is aesthetic'.
The 'Rain' stops. The 'Traffic' starts. It is a cause and effect relationship.
I asked for 'Mineral Water'. The waiter brought a bottle that looked refilled. I drank it with suspicion.
The 'Office Chair' makes a noise. Everyone looks. I pretend to be working hard.
My mom's 'Spice Box' is a treasure chest. It has spices from 1990. 'Vintage Masala'.
The 'TTE' checks the ticket. He looks at me. He looks at the photo. He sighs. I pass.
Why do we say 'Heavy Rain'? Is it weighing down the earth?
The 'Laptop Charger' is too short. I sit near the plug point like a dog on a leash.
I went to a 'Buffet'. I ate till I couldn't breathe. Value for money achieved.
The 'Watchman' ignores me all year. On Diwali, he salutes me like I am the President.
My dad's 'Phone Gallery' is full of blurry photos of newspapers. He archives news.
The 'Street Vendor' wraps food in exam papers. I ate Bhel Puri on a Physics question paper.
I tried to 'Bargain' at a mall. The cashier looked at me with pity. 'Sir, this is H&M'.
The 'Ceiling Fan' wobbles. It threatens to fall. We sleep under the danger.
Why do we say 'Passing Time'? Time passes us. We are stationary.
The 'Mosquito' buzzes. I slap my face. The mosquito laughs.
My mom thinks 'Pizza' is unhealthy. She serves 'Fried Bhatura'. 'This is homemade'. Logic.
The 'Cricket Match' stops traffic. Even the ambulance driver checks the score.
I bought 'Sunglasses'. I look like a bug. My friend looks like a movie star.
The 'Office Meeting' was boring. I drew doodles. It was my best work.
My dad kicks the 'Tyre' to check air. 'Sounds solid'. Scientific method.
The 'Train Toilet' door is heavy. You need muscles to open it.
The 'Remote Control' works if you hit it. Violence solves technical issues.
I asked for 'Water' at a restaurant. They brought 'Bottled Water'. I said 'Regular'. They judged me.
The 'Bus' turns. We lean. It is a group dance.
Why do we put 'Lemon' on cars? To ward off evil or to make lemonade in traffic?
The 'Wedding Photographer' flashes the light. I am blind for 5 minutes.
I asked for 'Ketchup'. They gave one sachet. I have 20 fries. Math error.
The 'Train Fan' vibrates. It generates noise, not air.
My dad's 'Password' is '12345'. 'Hackers won't guess it'. Yes they will, Dad.
The 'Street Cricket' ball goes into the drain. We fish it out. We play on. Dedication.
I went to a 'Buffet'. I built a food tower. It collapsed. Tragedy.
The 'Lift Button' is pressed 10 times. It doesn't come faster. Psychology.
My mom buys 'Bulk Vegetables'. We eat cauliflower for a week.
The 'Aadhaar Link' message. It haunts my dreams.
I asked the 'Waiter' for WiFi. He entered it secretly. Top secret clearance.
The 'Raincoat' smells rubbery. I smell like a tire.
My dad checks the 'Door Lock' by pulling it off the hinges.
The 'Invigilator' stares at me. I stare at the paper. Awkward.
Why do we say 'Time is Money' then waste time bargaining?
The 'Sofa Cover' is plastic. It sticks to my legs. Summer torture.
I asked for 'Mineral Water'. It cost Rs. 50. I sipped it slowly.
The 'Auto Driver' has no change. I lose Rs. 5. He wins.
My mom's 'Handbag' is a weapon. It swings and hits people.
The 'Flight' lands. We clap. Pilot is confused.
I tried to 'Diet'. I saw a Gulab Jamun. I failed.
The 'Train' is late. 'Inconvenience Regretted'. We know.
My dad wears 'Socks' with sandals. Fashion icon.
The 'Vegetable Vendor' gives free Curry Leaves. I feel rich.
I told my mom I want to be a 'Stand-up Comedian'. She said 'You are already a joke'.
The 'Indian Toilet' requires aim. The 'Western Toilet' requires trust in hygiene.
I went to a 'Mall'. I bought nothing. I enjoyed the AC. Success.
The 'Uber Driver' calls. 'Where are you?'. 'On the map'. 'Tell me landmark'. 'A cow is standing here'.
My dad thinks 'Dark Mode' saves 90% battery. He lives in darkness.
The 'Street Dog' howls at 3 AM. He is singing the song of his people.
I tried to make 'Chai'. It boiled over. The stove is a mess. Mom is angry.
The 'Bank' queue is long. One counter is open. The staff is having tea.
My mom saves 'Wrapping Paper'. She irons it. It is new again.
The 'Bus' stops. We jump. It is a leap of faith.
I asked for 'Discount'. The shopkeeper laughed. I paid full price.
The 'Laptop' heats up. It is a heater in winter.
My dad's 'Ring Tone' is a loud bell. It sounds like a fire alarm.
The 'Street Light' flickers. It is spooky.
I tried to 'Fix' the tap. I broke it. Water everywhere.
The 'Train' smells of pickle. It is a familiar scent.
My mom says 'Good Night'. Then she cleans the kitchen for an hour.
The biggest fear in Indian society is not death or taxes. It is 'Log Kya Kahenge?' (What will people say?).
I paid Rs. 20 via UPI. The processing circle spun for 10 seconds. My heart rate went up to 180. Financial anxiety.
The 'Mukhwas' (Fennel seeds) at the restaurant exit is the main course. We eat it by the handful.
My dad thinks 'Old Monk' is a medicine. 'Cold? Old Monk. Cough? Old Monk. Heartbreak? Old Monk.'
IST does not stand for Indian Standard Time. It stands for 'Indian Stretchable Time'. 5 PM means 6:30 PM.
My mom removed my 'Nazar' (Evil Eye) with salt and red chilies. I don't know if it worked, but the kitchen air made me cough for an hour.
My dad on WhatsApp: *Typing for 10 minutes*... *Typing stops*... *Typing resumes*... Message received: 'Ok'.
I did Engineering to get a job. Now I use my degree as a mousepad. It has excellent surface friction.
Asking for 'Extra Sambar' at a South Indian restaurant is not a request. It is a birthright.
Leaving a 'Family WhatsApp Group' is impossible. It is like trying to leave the Hotel California.
In India, everyone is 'Bhaiya' (Brother). The driver, the shopkeeper, the stranger, the guy stealing your parking spot. Everyone.
We ask the price of things we have zero intention of buying. 'Bhaiya, how much is this generator?'. Just for market research.
Using a phone in an Indian Toilet is an extreme sport. One slip, and your digital life goes down the drain.
I didn't have my morning Chai. Now I have a headache that requires an MRI scan. Addiction is real.
I saw a 'Fixed Price' shop. I still asked for a discount. The shopkeeper sighed. I sighed. It is tradition.
The Remote battery is dead. I rolled the cells. I bit the cells. I swapped their positions. It works now. Magic.
Shopkeeper: 'May I help you?'. Me: 'No, just looking'. (I am actually checking the price tag to see if I can afford to breathe here).
Indian Guest Rule: When offered water, refuse first. Then accept it reluctantly. Then drink the whole glass because it's 40 degrees outside.
I bought a toothbrush because it came with a 'Free Tongue Cleaner'. Marketing genius.
The Metro announcement says 'Doors Closing'. People rush in faster. The door is a challenge.
My order says 'Out for Delivery'. I am standing at the balcony like Juliet waiting for Romeo.
My mom has a secret stash of cash in the rice container. It is the family's emergency fund/central bank.
When my dad sneezes, car alarms in the parking lot go off. It is a sonic boom.
I lost a Tupperware bottle in school in 2005. My mom still brings it up in arguments in 2025.
Power Cut happens. Entire neighborhood comes to the balcony. 'Tumhare yahan bhi gayi?' (Is yours gone too?). Solidarity.
Relatives asked 'Is there scope in this field?'. I said 'There is scope everywhere if you are not lazy'. They stopped visiting.
I went to a wedding. I didn't see the Bride or Groom. I went straight to the Butter Naan counter. Priorities.
The Indian motto for solving problems: 'Chalta Hai' (It's okay/It works). The roof is leaking? Put a bucket. Chalta hai.
A dog chased my bike. I accelerated. He accelerated. I realized he is my personal trainer.
Guests arrived. My mom made me recite a poem I learned in 2nd grade. I am 24 years old.
The Auto Meter is just a decoration item. Like a chandelier. It looks nice but serves no functional purpose.
My friend said 'Bas 2 min mein pahuncha' (Reaching in 2 mins). He hasn't even taken a bath yet.
The Fan Regulator has numbers 1 to 5. But it only has two speeds: 'Turtle' and 'Hurricane'.
The Shampoo bottle is empty. I put water in it. Now I have 'Diluted Shampoo'. Infinite supply hack.
We squeeze the toothpaste tube until it begs for mercy. We roll it, flatten it, and threaten it to give the last drop.
I finally met 'Sharmaji Ka Beta'. He is also unemployed and confused. The legend was a lie.
My mom negotiated with the vegetable vendor for 10 minutes to save Rs. 5. Then she gave Rs. 20 to a beggar. It's not about money, it's about the game.
The Traffic Signal timer shows 3 seconds. Everyone revs their engines like it is the start of a Formula 1 race.
In a crowded bus, there is always room for one more. 'Thoda adjust karlo' (Please adjust a little) defies the laws of physics.
Why is Indian humor the best? Because we can laugh at our parents, our politicians, our traffic, and our tragedy, all while drinking a hot cup of chai.
